This is Farangis Makhkamova, dressmaker from Shakhrinav.
She also has a solar panel and a water heater in her house. She now has over 25 students. Solar panel and water heater sped up the work.

This is the Fozil Nosirov's Kulolgari workshop.
Here he and his students make different national jugs.
They need a lot of hot water. 

And here solar panels and water heaters come to the rescue üéâ

School #3, Shahrinav's district, has installed solar panels and water heaters for a year. Schoolchildren have always had problems with hot water. Especially during a pandemic. Now, thanks to PO ARET and the @USEmbDushanbe, ‚Äã‚Äãthis problem has been solved.
#RenewableEnergy #TJK https://t.co/6cAH2U0vwV

This is the village of Shakhrinav in the Dusti district. And here is the solar kitchen, powered by a solar panel and a water heater.

These panels are installed with the assistance of the PO ARET and the @USEmbDushanbe.
#Tajikistan #Dushanbe
#RenewableEnergy https://t.co/j4g13DTmCI

Kutbiya Jonshoeva from Dusti, a woman who survived violence and now helps other women.

She has solar panels and water heaters installed in her organization with the help of PO ARET & @USEmbDushanbe.

Now women can easily participate in cooking courses.
#RenewableEnergy https://t.co/PRULArkVp9

We also visited one of the schools in Shurabad. The solar panel and water heater have been operating there for a year.

Earlier, children after physical education could not even wash their hands.

Now they can shower after gym class.

#Eco #Darvoz #Pollution #NR 
#RenewableEnergy https://t.co/BqEzqZStRH
